    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Raja Rakshasa</h1>When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal. The hands of a raja rakshasa are more subtly unsettling, for the fingers of these fiends bend outward, away from the palms.<br /><br /> More than any other types of rakshasa, rajas scoff at religion. They understand the power of the divine, yet they view themselves as the only things worthy of worship from mortal creatures; not even their own immortals are deemed deserving of such glorification. Raja rakshasas often form close-knit families that work together to bring down mortal cities or to rule them from the shadows within. Such families of rakshasas often incorporate other breeds of the fiend, often using dandasukas as favored servants or stealthy spies. Even though a raja family works together to achieve a shared goal, infighting and treachery among their own is a constant threat.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 27<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=345">Raja Rakshasa</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 10</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Rakshasa_RajaRakshasa.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Rakshasa_RajaRakshasa.png"></a><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><span alt="Rakshasa Trait" class="trait" title="Reincarnations of evil souls, rakshasas are fiends that live on the Material Plane."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=233">Rakshasa</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 275</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +19; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=11"><u>Undercommon</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +23, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +21, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +21, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=11"><u>Occultism</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=12"><u>Performance</a></u> +19, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +20<br /><b>Str</b> +4, <b>Dex</b> +6, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> +2, <b>Wis</b> +1, <b>Cha</b> +5<br /><b>Items</b> <i>+1 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=56">kukri</a></i><hr /><b>AC</b> 30, <b>Fort</b> +19, <b>Ref</b> +21, <b>Will</b> +18; +2 status to all saves vs. magic, +3 status to all saves vs. divine magic<br /><b>HP</b> 155; <b>Resistances</b> physical 10 (except piercing); <b>Weaknesses</b> good 10<br /><b>Scoff at the Divine</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> <b>Trigger</b> A creature within 30 feet casts a divine spell or uses a divine ability. <b>Requirements</b> The raja rakshasa has an unexpended spell slot that can be used to cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=78"><i>dispel magic</i></a>. <b>Effect</b> The raja rakshasa expends a spell slot that could be used to cast dispel magic and attempts to counteract the triggering spell or ability. The raja rakshasa can’t Scoff at the Divine for 1d4 rounds.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 35 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>kukri</i> +23 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=196"><u>trip</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d6+10 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fangs +20 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d12+10 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +22 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+10 slashing</span><b>Occult Spontaneous Spells</b> DC 31; <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=144">hallucination</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=273">shadow blast</a></u></i> (3 slots); <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=40">clairvoyance</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=125">fly</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=315">suggestion</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=39">clairaudience</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=209">nondetection</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=354">vampiric touch</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=28">blur</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=150">hideous laughter</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=34">charm</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=160">illusory object</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=166">item facade</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(5th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=132">ghost sound</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=177">mage hand</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=246">read aura</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=286">sigil</a></u></i><br /><b>Occult Innate Spells</b> DC 31; <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=194">mind reading</a></u></i> (at will)<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Change Shape</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=120"><u>occult</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=127"><u>polymorph</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) The raja rakshasa takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesn’t change the raja rakshasa’s Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). It typically loses its fangs Strike unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Disturbing Vision</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=120"><u>occult</a></u>) The raja rakshasa’s eyes flash green as it projects a telepathic wave in a 30-foot emanation. All creatures in the area are assailed by a vision of evil decadence from one of the rakshasa’s past lives. Each non-evil creature in the area must succeed at a DC 29 Will save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34">sickened 1</a> (and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=36">stunned 1</a> on a critical failure). The visions last 1d4 rounds, and while they do, the raja rakshasa and all evil creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to all checks. The raja rakshasa can use this ability again only once the previous visions end.</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Raja Heads</h3>Raja's heads often resemble those
of cats or snakes, but they can
also be similar to apes, jackals,
vultures, elephants, mantises,
lizards, rhinos, boars, and more are
possible. In most cases, the type
of head a raja rakshasa possesses
symbolizes its personality—a
tiger-headed one is stealthy and
ravenous, while a boar-headed one
might be gluttonous and crude.<h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=85">Rakshasa</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=344">Dandasuka</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=345">Raja Rakshasa</a></td><td>10</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=85">Rakshasa</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 274</i></a><br />Rakshasas are evil spirits that cloak themselves in the guises of humanoid creatures, that they might walk unseen among their prey. They embody what is taboo among most societies, and in the shape of those they seek to defile, rakshasas gorge themselves on these hideous acts. A wide range of rakshasas exist; presented below are the diminutive, sinister dandasuka rakshasa and the infamous raja rakshasa, who are the most widespread and commonly encountered of these fiends.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Rakshasa Immortals</h3>Above all rakshasas rule the
rakshasa immortals, powerful
unique entities who deem
themselves deities. These beings
include Aksha of the Second
Breath, Bundha the Singing
Butcher, Dradjit the Godslayer,
Kunkarna the Dream Warrior,
Mursha the Beastmaster,
Otikaya the Spirit Archer,
Surpa the Avenger,
Zabha the Desecrator,
and untold others.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
